title: How to Add More Fonts to WPS Office on Your Android Device

steps.title: Connect your Android device to your PC using a USB cable.
steps.content: Connect your Android device to your PC using a USB cable. When a pop-up appears, select 'Connect as USB mass storage' / 'Media device' (depending on what your device lists out) to enable you to transfer files from PC to phone and vice versa. If a pop up doesn't appear, draw your notifications up and select from there - for example, the notification you get if your PC successfully installs your Android device.

steps.title: Open Windows Explorer or "My Computer" on your PC.
steps.content: Open Windows Explorer or "My Computer" on your PC.

steps.title: Go to Computer and open 'Local disk (C:
steps.content: Go to Computer and open 'Local disk (C: ) - it has the Windows logo attached to it.

steps.title: Open the 'Fonts' folder in this location.
steps.content: Open the 'Fonts' folder in this location. This folder has the letter A in blue and bold attached to it.

steps.title: Select and copy your desired fonts.
steps.content: Select and copy your desired fonts. Please note that you might not be able to copy from local disk (C:) directly to phone storage so, what you'll have to do is to copy from local disk (C:) to local disk (D:) or a flash drive then, from that location to your phone storage.

steps.title: Go back to Windows explorer and open your Android device (device storage).
steps.content: Go back to Windows explorer and open your Android device (device storage).

steps.title: Open the folder with the name 'Fonts' and paste your copied fonts files.
steps.content: Open the folder with the name 'Fonts' and paste your copied fonts files.

steps.title: Disconnect you Android device.
steps.content: Disconnect you Android device. You can now open WPS Office on your mobile and check your fonts out.
